stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Scavenger
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] 4 years
[Place of Birth] Unknown
[Date of Birth] August 22
[Race] Zalak
[Height] 164cm
[Infection Status] 
Infection confirmed by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Excellent 
[Mobility] Normal 
[Physical Resilience] Normal 
[Tactical Acumen] Normal 
[Combat Skill] Excellent 
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Banished from her community for being Infected, she has made a living as a mercenary in the criminal underworld. She is skilled in matters best left unsaid, and as a result of the base nature of the work has become known as 'Scavenger.' Since her introduction to Rhodes Island through an intermediary, she has given up her mercenary life to become an Operator.

Imaging tests have shown the outlines of her internal organs to be indistinct due to abnormal shadows. Originium granules have been detected in her circulatory system, confirming her to be infected with Oripathy.

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 12% 
Operator has no obvious Originium crystals externally, however, tests have revealed an abundance of crystals internally. The limbic system of the brain has been particularly affected, and the Operator's personality changes are suspected to be related to this.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.29u/L
Due to high presence of Originium within the internal organ's, the Operator's circulatory system has a high Originium content.

Having been exiled by her tribe, betrayed by her client, and endured all manner of hardships, Scavenger prefers to act alone and is wary of others. Moreover, since her personality has been affected by Originium, she has become difficult to communicate with. Perhaps she'll open up a bit once she gets used to working at Rhodes Island.

Scavenger moves freely in harsh environments and will eat almost anything as long as it won't kill her. She is one of the most adaptable Operators, of truly unparalleled versatility. When given the chance, she enjoys resting in dark corners or eating a few specific foods.

Scavenger prefers to avoid other operators until it's not required for her work, with the exception of Provence. She tends to sneer at those who ask her about her interest in Provence, which is reflective of some sort of attraction. While Provence is considered generally attractive (many Operators particularly enjoy fluffing her tail), Scavenger seems to be interested in something else....

Scavenger once loved a young woman from her own tribe, who reciprocated her feelings. For whatever reason, they did not express their feelings to one another until Scavenger became Infected and was banished from her tribe. The next time Scavenger was able to meet the young lady, she had already passed away and with her the knowledge of their forbidden love. This memory is a keepsake that Scavenger will forever hold close to her heart.

No one understands why a covert mercenary would use such a heavy weapon for sneak attacks, as it is clearly unsuitable. Despite this disadvantage, Scavenger still manages to operate effectively. When others see her pass by, they typically come under the impression that she is not an assassin so much as an individual who will stop at nothing to eliminate everything in her path. No one doubts her abilities, and as for the actual truth behind her choice of weaponry? Who cares.

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.

Striker Series/Survive. A product of Raythean Industries, adopting the latest in adaptive clothing material, paired with an all-encompassing tailoring that tightly hugs the skin, ensuring operators' survival under the most extreme circumstances.

modules.desc:
Operator Scavenger has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for preemptive penetration of the battlefield situation and active offense so as to secure leeway for deployment.
This operator shall hereby be appointed a Vanguard Operator during field operations to exercise Pioneer responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

'Bowls are for holding food. Spoons are for scooping it. Canteens hold water. Cut up big pieces of food with your knife like this, stick your fork in, and you can put it in your mouth and eat it. You all got that?'
It's the young Zalaks' first time at the dinner table, learning how to use the tableware, and Hamelin is among them. She's never seen such sumptuous dishes before, their glistening sheen like flowing gold.
'Hamelin, when I grow up, I'm gonna make sure we eat really tasty food like this every day!'
Hearing the voice beside her perk up, she turns to look and is met with her sweetheart's smile.
Much, much later, when she's long since left her tribe, left her beloved, Hamelin skulks alone in the dark. It's been so long she hasn't the energy left to recall the scene. Even filling her stomach is too much to ask now.
Another mission nobody else was willing to take. Her failing to contact her target the first time has lost her all her equipment, the only thing saving her life being the ditch she hid in. The aftermath of this mission failure will be hard to shoulder, but she's void of fighting capacity anyhow. Hamelin presses forward, limping against the damp brick wall, eyes sweeping over the putrid filth, searching for anything she can make use of. Eventually, in the thick of the mud, she catches sight of a portable dining set that's been thrown away.
She picks it up, wipes it off, hangs it on her waist, and then climbs out of the sewer, finding the restaurant where her target sits.
In the process of taking out her target, every item in the set finds its use: the bowl, the spoon, the fork, the knife, the canteen... In a first for her, she's done an efficient job, undetected by anyone. Hamelin exits the lavish, high-end restaurant, and wanders alone onto the streets. She feels famished, completely out of strength. Winding down, she slowly slumps against a wall, pulls in her knees, and buries her head deep.
'Hello? You hungry? Want something to eat?'
Hamelin raises her head to find a large-tailed Lupo girl. The girl leads Hamelin back to her office, and places before her the remainders of her food supplies.
'It's all we've got. Put something inside you, okay?'
Watching Hamelin's movements, her brows suddenly knit.
'Hey, don't use your hands—you're carrying tableware, aren't you? Are you not that good with it? Let me teach you.
'Put your food in the bowl, then use that spoon to scoop up a mouthful. You can cut up big chunks of food with a knife, and stick it on your fork to eat it. Hand me your canteen—I'll fill you up some water.
'If you go hungry again, you're free to stop by every day for something to eat... huh? What's wrong?'
Hamelin stares up, blinking frantically, refusing to let the tears fall from the corners of her eyes.

voice_lines.voiceText: Better to get your job done first than wasting time on chitchat.
You'd better remember that failing to adapt makes you a useless burden.
Work, eat, run, repeat. Big fricking whoop. Isn't that how life is for anyone these days?
My job was to take care of 'troubles' for my employers. Eventually they started to call me Scavenger.
Just like the two sides of a coin, no matter how splendid the face is, the backside is always stained with dirt.
I've adapted to this place really well since I joined? Pfft, rubbish. It's just that I've gotten used to working on the surface.
That's Provence, isn't it…? The wretched girl who got Infected while rescuing people from a Catastrophe... Look at that massive tail she's got...
You know, Doctor... I hated the idea of working with other people, at first. I figured our methods would clash. But at some point, I came to realize that's not the case.
If only she were still alive... Now all I can do is carry on alone, carrying her dreams on my back.
How can you sleep so soundly when you're defenseless…?
I'm Scavenger. Leave the dirty work to me. Just pay me like my other employers and we'll be good.
No, it's not enough...
This still isn't enough. I need to become stronger...
Thanks, Doctor. I feel like I have a reason to fight now.
Do I need to quip just 'cause I joined the team?
Don't you hold me back.
Conceal yourselves so the enemy won't find you.
Hmph, time for a clean up.
Hurry up.
Are we doing this?
Tch.
I know what to do.
Garbage.
Keep writhing in the gutter!
There is no turning back for you!
You get no sympathy!
Gotta say that mission was a special one.
Hmph. They have only their own weakness to blame.
Tch, some of them got away. I'm disappointed in you.
Dammit! Screwed up again...
Just give me a dark corner.
Argh! Let go of me!
What? You want me to dispose of you too?
Arknights.
New Year's? Tsk, just another day, nothing different. But if you need a reminder, crowded places mean more stupid crap can happen, so don't get too lost in the fun, okay?
You got a job for me?
I did used to take birthdays seriously... but who's out there still counting out every year they live these day...? Whatever. If you'd like, I could wish you have fun today or something.

Ugh. Just waiting for you to clear out before I grab some cheese from in there. What? My job's never been anything but cleaning up the filthiest of places. Telling me my name's gonna show up on your honor roll?

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to the Control Center, increases Morale of all Operators in the Control Center by <@cc.vup>+0.05</> per hour.
When this Operator is assigned to a Factory, capacity limit <@cc.vup>+8</> and Morale consumed per hour <@cc.vup>-0.25</>
